data.title: Prevent crash dialog from popping up when the game restarts
data.body: Fixes #6887

data.title: Crash while restarting the game
data.body:
Start OpenRA.
Change the window mode from Fullscreen to Windowed or the other way round.
A new window will be opened, but the old one shows this fatal error thing.

> pchote: the auto-restart makes it return a non-zero error code
> pchote: which is then detected as a crash

data.title: Added loadscreen performance measurements
data.body: Mostly to debunk the myth that the configuration fields I added for the d2k mod slow down things compared to the hard-coded cnc mod one.

data.title: RA - Updated AI
data.body: Ra AIs were using similar unpowerful units. I added more units to make it better.

data.title: Crashed when tried to kill own dogs with other dogs (around 50 of them)
data.body:
I had some dogs in middle of big empty map (333x333), and then i attacked my own dogs, just for the fun -- because earlier i found out a different bug which allows me to turn all my selected dogs dead at once if i attack with them at same time to a single object. Apparently that was not a bug since that issue was closed: https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6798

Weird thing is that i didnt get a popup telling me OpenRA had crashed, is this new feature of new release? Or did i just tick "dont show this again" accidentally earlier?

Logs:
https://gist.github.com/VagueVigor/df36f0e8077418597e5f
https://gist.github.com/VagueVigor/f67a1cdc0bceccc05ea7

```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20141029
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18444
```

data.title: Added Media.PlayMusic to the Lua API
data.body: and make use of it on the shellmaps to fix https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6071.

data.title: Automatically check the Lua scripts for errors
data.body:
With the old Lua API the missions broke a lot. The situation has improved, but I fear breakage will come in the future and with more missions, manual testing is not feasible. My idea is some kind of OpenRA.Lint rule to execute Lua script and check for breakage. It should at least go through WorldLoaded or find other obvious problem such as syntax errors and broken actor references.

I started at https://github.com/Mailaender/OpenRA/compare/lint-map-scripts but it does not work at all.

data.title: Added a captureable flag
data.body: for use as an alternative to the MISS building used in KotH maps or in a CTF mode. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5189

data.title: Measure SpriteFont in perf.log
data.body: Uses FT_Load_Char in our SpriteFont code as suggested in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3436. Compare also http://www.freetype.org/freetype2/docs/tutorial/step1.html. Adds performance measurements to the pre cache methods. Spoiler: this does not change anything in that regard. Makes use of the face creation simplification from the https://github.com/Robmaister/SharpFont/#cross-platform-freetype-bindings-for-net README.

data.title: Measure long TickRender in perf.log
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5384/ to extend this on the Render\* traits.

data.title: Measure BuildDomains in perf.log
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/3375 and https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5184.

data.title: Added a warning when the map cordon is small
data.body: Tiny map cordons caused problems in the past. This warns about them. The RecommendedCordonSize is probably still debatable. Also whether we should remove some maps from the repository that violate this rule.

data.title: TS  - Added more crushers.
data.body: Only MCVs was crusher to infantry. I made Mammoth Tank, Titan, Mammoth Mk II., Devil's Tongue, Disruptor, Tick Tank and Stealth Tank can crush infantries too.

data.title: Fixed Fort Lonestar and Drop Zone maps and added a test to check map rule loading
data.body: Fixes #6869 and makes sure it won't slip through again.

data.title: Added filters to repeated orders
data.body:
I hope https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/3923 addresses a lot of CPU and network performance problems when people click the same spot many times as seen by high APM *Craft players.

~~Note: there is still some leakage. You order a unit to attack, move somewhere, attack the same thing and it gets filtered. Not sure why. I added a lot of resets.~~ I simplified the implementation a lot and solved this on my own.

data.title: Fix Bogus Yaml Removals at Fort Lonestar
data.body: Fixes #6869 and makes new crate powerups to unable.

data.title: Fort Lonestar has broken rules
data.body:
```
Failed to load rules for Fort Lonestar with error Actor type crate: Bogus yaml removals: [LevelUpCrateAction, False], [GiveMcvCrateAction, False], [RevealMapCrateAction, False], [HideMapCrateAction, False], [ExplodeCrateAction@nuke, False], [ExplodeCrateAction@boom, False], [ExplodeCrateAction@fire, False], [GiveUnitCrateAction@jeep, False], [GiveUnitCrateAction@arty, False], [GiveUnitCrateAction@v2rl, False], [GiveUnitCrateAction@1tnk, False], [GiveUnitCrateAction@2tnk, False], [GiveUnitCrateAction@3tnk, False], [GiveUnitCrateAction@4tnk, False]
```

Unplayable on the current release

data.title: StyleCop cleanup of the Network code
data.body: Only cosmetics, no logic changes.

data.title: performance problems
data.body:
me and norman experienced performance problems "ingame" in the new release ... its hard to describe , but it feels like a mix between a lag and choppy gameplay ... the game ... just speeds up and calms down sometimes ... which makes units hard to handle 

 it might be related to the new introduced "MAX-Speed" button for the Replays ... 

@pchote told me this here :
there were engine changes behind that which disconnect the rendering from the ticking
before those changes there always used to be at least one render for each tick
now, if the game is going slow, it will do multiple ticks per render
to try and reduce the lag

data.title: Clean up some chars.
data.body:
Removed some special characters.

Trying to automate this in bash without mangling names failed horribly.

data.title: after game chat and stat
data.body: Now you cannot watch stats and chat at the same time

data.title: After game scrolling on map
data.body: I miss beeing able to see the whole map

data.title: Bundled thirdparty
data.body:
Please provide build instructions for all the 3rdparty libraries etc.

In Fedora, distribution of prebuilt assemblies is not allowed. All has to be based on available sources, also for legal reasons.
https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/Packaging:Mono?rd=Packaging/Mono#Distributing_Prebuilt_Assemblies

data.title: License texts for content like bundled fonts and included maps
data.body:
You should provide correct license texts for the bundled fonts. AFAIK, those FreeFonts are from GNU.

You should provide licence texts for the included maps. In IRC, antares79 said they are all cc by-nc-sa, then please mark them as so.

For Fedora official packaging, both are MUST.

data.title: fixes crash in minimap generator for some of maps
Defenses could target the most dangerous units for themselves
data.body:
Let's say I have a tesla coil and 6 enemy soldiers are coming : 3 riflemen and 3 bazookas with the 3 riflemen in front.
The tesla will shoot the 3 riflemen because they are the nearest and during the tesla's cooldown the 3 bazookas will shoot at it (and maybe destroy it).
The tesla could shoot the first rifleman because he is the first in sight but then shoot 2 of the bazookas (they became in sight during the first kill) because they are more dangerous for the tesla.
It would be difficult to balance (what to do if the tesla sees 20 different units with different positions and different healths ?) but it would be a smarter defense (the tesla would survive longer and deal more damage).

data.title: Ability to choose from where the paratroopers come
data.body: Be able to choose from where the plane carrying the paratroopers come would be more effective. Currently having an effective parachute drop is rather like throwing a dice (because of anti air things).
